which Pierre recalled, counting them on his fingers, he felt already in his soul: courage, generosity, morality, love of mankind, and es- pecially obedience which did not even seem to him a virtue, but a joy. (He now felt so glad to be free from his own lawlessness and to sub- mit his will to those who knew the indubitable truth.) He forgot what the seventh virtue was and could not recall it. 
The third time the Rhetor came back more quickly and asked Pierre whether he was still firm
